sen.j: 高葛陂（高葛坡、こう かっぱ、1724年 - 1776年）は、江戸時代中期の漢詩人・儒学者。
sen.e: Kappa KO (1724 - 1776) was a composer of Chinese poems and Confucian scholar in the mid Edo period.
Kappa KO (1724 - 1776) was a composer of Chinese poems and Confucian scholar in the mid Edo period.
Kappa KO (1724 - 1776) was a composer of Chinese poems and Confucian scholar in the mid Edo period.
His name was Shun.
His name was Shun.
His name was Shun.

sen.j: 字は伯起（たかおき）、維岳、道昂。
sen.e: His azana were Takaoki, Igaku and Doko.
sen.cmt: 「維岳」、「道昂」の読みは、用語集、サイトにも見当たらず、定かではありません。
sen.e: His azana were Takaoki, Igaku and Doko.
His azana were Takaoki, Igaku and Doko.

sen.j: 通称は嘉右衛門、小左衛門。
sen.e: His common name was Kaemon and Kozaemon.
His common name was Kaemon and Kozaemon.
His common name was Kaemon and Kozaemon.
Kappa was his appellation.
Kappa was his appellation.
Kappa was his appellation.
His another appellation was Isai.
His another appellation was Isai.
His another appellation was Isai.

sen.j: 先祖は明代末に日本に来た中国人。
sen.e: His ancestor was a Chinese who came to Japan in the end of Ming Dynasty period in China.
His ancestor was a Chinese who came to Japan in the end of Ming Dynasty period in China.
His ancestor was a Chinese who came to Japan in the end of Ming Dynasty period in China.

sen.j: 晩年に姓を王に改めた。
sen.e: He changed his surname to O in his last years.
He changed his surname to O in his last years.
He changed his surname to O in his last years.

sen.j: 享保9年に大阪で生まれた。
sen.e: He was born in Osaka in 1724.
sen.cmt: 「享保9年」＝グレゴリオ暦「西暦1724年1月26日」、出典：http://maechan.net/kanreki
sen.e: He was born in Osaka in 1724.
He was born in Osaka in 1724.
He was raised in Katsushika, Shimousa, Edo.
He was raised in Katsushika, Shimousa, Edo.
He was raised in Katsushika, Shimousa, Edo.
He studied under Tsukuba ISHIJIMA.
He studied under Tsukuba ISHIJIMA.
He studied under Tsukuba ISHIJIMA.

sen.j: 父の死後、定住せず各地を放浪。
sen.e: After his father's death, he wandered about various places without settling down.
After his father's death, he wandered about various places without settling down.
After his father's death, he wandered about various places without settling down.

sen.j: 放浪の間に京都を何度も訪れ、富小路二条上ルにて私塾を開いた。
sen.e: During his wandering, he visited Kyoto repeatedly and opened his private school at Tomikoji Nijo agaru.
During his wandering, he visited Kyoto repeatedly and opened his private school at Tomikoji Nijo agaru.
During his wandering, he visited Kyoto repeatedly and opened his private school at Tomikoji Nijo agaru.

sen.j: 私塾には池大雅・与謝蕪村・大典顕常・菅茶山などが通っていた。
sen.e: IKE no Taiga, Buson YOSA, Kenjo DAITEN, Chazan KAN and others attended the school.
IKE no Taiga, Buson YOSA, Kenjo DAITEN, Chazan KAN and others attended the school.
IKE no Taiga, Buson YOSA, Kenjo DAITEN, Chazan KAN and others attended the school.

sen.j: 皆川淇園・龍草廬・岡崎盧門・韓天寿・高芙蓉など当時の著名な儒学者・漢文学者との交流があった。
sen.e: He had relationships with famous Confucian scholars and Chinese classical literary persons in those days including Kien MINAGAWA, Soro RYU, Romon OKAZAKI, Tenju KAN and Fuyo KO.
sen.cmt: 「岡崎盧門」の読みは、下記サイトから引用いたしました。http://www.wul.waseda.ac.jp/kotenseki/html/chi10/chi10_04151/index.html
sen.e: He had relationships with famous Confucian scholars and Chinese classical literary persons in those days including Kien MINAGAWA, Soro RYU, Romon OKAZAKI, Tenju KAN and Fuyo KO.
He had relationships with famous Confucian scholars and Chinese classical literary persons in those days including Kien MINAGAWA, Soro RYU, Romon OKAZAKI, Tenju KAN and Fuyo KO.

sen.j: 漢詩を収めた『葛陂先生枖杜集』を著した。
sen.e: He wrote "Kappa Sensei ---" containing Chinese-style poems.
sen.cmt: 「一原文一訳文の例外対処」『葛陂先生枖杜集』は、用語集、サイトにもなく、「枖」は広辞苑にも見当たらず、読むことが不可能です。
sen.e: He wrote "Kappa Sensei ---" containing Chinese-style poems.
He wrote "Kappa Sensei ---" containing Chinese-style poems.

sen.j: 著書の多くは残存せず、儒学者としての業績を知る資料は少ない。
sen.e: As most of his books are not existent, there are a small number of materials which show his achievements as a Confucian scholar.
As most of his books are not existent, there are a small number of materials which show his achievements as a Confucian scholar.
As most of his books are not existent, there are a small number of materials which show his achievements as a Confucian scholar.
